intro: Tylecodon paniculatus, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like birds and insects. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. It grows in dense clumps and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Tylecodon paniculatus is often cultivated for its vibrant floral display and drought-resistant properties.
